conclusion: To solve the problem, calculate initial and final magnetic flux through the coil using given area and magnetic induction intensity, then determine the change by considering rotation angle.

The image shows a rectangular coil ABCO with sides parallel to x, y, and z axes. Coil initially positioned perpendicular to x-axis. Magnetic induction intensity along positive x-axis. Coil rotates 60° downward around z-axis.
The area of the coil ABCO is given as 0.4 m².
The magnetic induction intensity of the uniform magnetic field is B = 0.1 T.
Initially, the plane of the coil is perpendicular to the x-axis, so the initial magnetic flux is Φ_initial = B × S = 0.1 × 0.4 = 0.04 Wb.
After rotating 60° downward, the plane of the coil becomes inclined to the x-axis. The final magnetic flux is Φ_final = B × S × cos(60°) = 0.1 × 0.4 × 0.5 = 0.02 Wb.
The change in magnetic flux is ΔΦ = Φ_final - Φ_initial = 0.02 - 0.04 = -0.02 Wb.
The negative sign indicates a decrease in magnetic flux.
